title: Big Hole Found in China That Tells a New Story About Earth
summary: Scientists have found a huge hole in China that was made when a big rock from space hit Earth a long time ago. This hole is in Guangdong, and it is 900 meters wide, which is much bigger than other holes from the same time. The rock that hit Earth was a meteorite, and it made the ground shake and break. Scientists found special rocks called quartz that show signs of being hit very hard. This hole is special because it did not wear away over time, even though the area usually has a lot of rain and wind that can destroy things. This discovery helps us learn more about what happened to Earth in the past and how meteorites can change our planet. It is exciting because it shows that big events like this can happen and leave marks that last for thousands of years.

background_read: A crater is a hole in the ground that can be made by things like meteorites hitting Earth. Meteorites are rocks from space that sometimes fall to our planet. When they hit, they can make big craters and change the land. Scientists study these craters to learn about Earth's history and how it has been affected by events from space. The Holocene is the current time period in Earth's history, starting after the last ice age. Erosion is when natural forces like rain and wind slowly break down rocks and soil over time. Finding a well-preserved crater in a place with high erosion is rare and helps scientists understand how such features can survive.
Article_Structure: WHAT: A large meteorite impact crater was found, measuring 900 meters wide.
WHY: It helps rewrite Earth's recent history by showing a major impact event.

perspectives.description: Scientists are excited because this crater provides new evidence about meteorite impacts in recent Earth history.
The crater's preservation in a high-erosion area makes it valuable for studying how landforms survive over time.
